author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Pakistan’s 36 airports on red alert fearing militant attackTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Pakistan’s 36 airports on red alert fearing militant attack Published on : Thursday, August 27, 2015
The government of Pakistan has placed the country’s 36 airports on red alert fearing retaliation from militants. The action comes after a positive report on fighting terrorism from the government.
According to media reports, earlier this week, a ground offensive against the Taliban in North and South Waziristan was launched by Pakistani military forces, in which five soldiers and six Taliban members were reported killed.
Security of major airports, including Benazir Bhutto International Airport and Nur Khan Airbase, had been beefed up on Tuesday (Aug 25), said sources adding extra caution was extended to all airports.
A senior security official told Dawn, Pakistan English daily, that temporary passes for visitors had been cancelled.
He said, people entering airport premises were being subjected to questioning and search.
Although security had been heightened at airports, passengers were being handled smoothly, the official added.
